exclusion:
• Connect module to power supply
  • bring module within maximum 1 meter (3 feet) of the main controller,
  • enable add/remove mode on main controller,
  • press service button S for more than 6 second or
  • press push button I1 five times within 3s (5 times change switch state within 3 seconds).

By this function all parameters of the module are set to default values and own ID is deleted.
If service button S is pressed more than 2 and less than 6second module is excluded, but configuration parameters are not set to default values
inclusion:
• Connect module to power supply,
  • bring module within maximum 1 meter (3 feet) of the main controller,
  • enable add/remove mode on main controller,
  • auto-inclusion (30 minutes after connected to power supply) or
  • press service button S for more than 2 second or
  • press push button I1 three times within 3s (3 times change switch state within 3
    seconds).
label: ZMNHBA
overview:
This Z-Wave module is used for switching on or off two electrical devices (e.g. lights, fans, etc ...).
The module can be controlled either through Z-Wave network or through the wall switches.
The module is designed to be mounted inside a “flush mounting box”, hidden behind a traditional wall switch.
Module measures power consumption of two electrical devices and supports connection of digital temperature sensor.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameters.description: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameters.overview: Flush 1 relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

options.label: ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameters.label: Automatic turning off relay Q1 after set time
parameters.description: Automatic turning off relay Q1 after set time
parameters.overview:
Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 10 mseconds

  • 0 = Auto OFF disabled
  • 1–65535 = 0,01 second – 655,35 seconds

parameters.label: Automatic turning off relay Q2 after set time
parameters.description: Automatic turning off relay Q2 after set time
parameters.overview:
Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 10 mseconds

  • 0 = Auto OFF disabled
  • 1–65535 = 0,01 second – 655,35 seconds

parameters.label: Saving Q1 and Q2 after a power failure
parameters.description: Saving the state of the relays Q1 and Q2 after a power failure

options.label: Do not save state after a power failure

parameters.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q1
parameters.description: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q1
parameters.overview:
Power report is sent (pushed) only when actual power in Watts in real time changed for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.

  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled

parameters.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q2
parameters.description: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q2
parameters.overview:
Power report is sent (pushed) only when actual power in Watts in real time changed for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.

  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–100 = 1% - 100% Reporti

parameters.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q1
parameters.description: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q1
parameters.overview:
Default value is 300 (power report in Watts is sent each 300s)

  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–65535 = 1 second – 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled.

Power report is sent with time interval set by entered value.

parameters.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q2
parameters.description: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q2
parameters.overview:
Default value is 300 (power report in Watts is sent each 300s)

  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–65535 = 1 second – 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled.  

Power report is sent with time interval set by entered value.
